parent_collections.title: SureSelect XT HS2 DNA to prepare libraries for single-cell Whole Genome Sequencing (scWGS) after single-cell Whole Genome Amplification (scWGA)

{"blocks":[{"key":"593h9","text":"Add   of the Fragmentation master mix to each sample well containing   of input DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9sn4o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"7","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8p9mm","text":"Mix well by pipetting up and down 20 times or cap the wells and vortex at high speed for 5–10 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4ukl4","text":"Spin the samples briefly and place on the PCR plate cooler.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5gcvd","text":"Place the tubes/strip in the thermal cycler and start the ‘Enzymatic Fragmentation’ program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1f3vo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"82j3p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"f7gei","text":"Note: Place the strips in the thermal cycler in an order to perform the recommended enzymatic fragmentation time based on Table 1. As an example, place first a strip with samples that require 10 min fragmentation and 2 min later a strip with samples that require 8 min fragmentation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vj31","text":"When the program reaches the   Hold step, remove the samples from the thermal cycler.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4pdb9","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8h6r4","text":"The 50 μl reactions are now ready for NGS sequencing library preparation (Section 2).","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5i03n","text":"This is not a stopping point in the workflow, and analysis of the enzymatically fragmented samples is not required prior to library preparation. Moreover, electrophoretic analysis of the fragmented samples may produce misleading results due to the presence of agents that affect DNA fragment migration.","type":"ordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Section 1: Enzymatic DNA Fragmentation (Manually)
